chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd Harrison Ingraham II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED AND STAYED
If revoked, 2 days credit
If revoked, defendant shall pay court costs as previously ordered.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.
Defendant shall submit to random, observed testing for alcohol.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Todd Harrison Ingraham II in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Todd Harrison Ingraham II. Defendant to plead to charge. State recommends 6 months jail and court costs, imposed and stayed with 2 years probation, counseling, absolute sobriety, costs. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State heard. Attorney Richards heard. Defendant heard. Court orders 6 months jail and court costs, imposed and stayed, probation 2 years with conditions: Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate; not to possess or consume alcohol; random, observed testing for alcohol; DNA; court costs to Clerk of Court.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Todd Harrison Ingraham II appeared by video, Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Todd Harrison Ingraham II, Attorney Anthony Pozorski appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives reading and pleads not guilty. Status and trial weeks set.
Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Todd Harrison Ingraham II appeared in court, Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared in court for Todd Harrison Ingraham II, Attorney Anthony Pozorski appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Verified address. Court reviewed complaint, penalties & Charges. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court reviewed waiver of hearing rights. Court finds the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives his rights and binds the matter over. State will prepare and file Information later. State requests signature bond - no contact with Officer Morrell unless emergency necessary. Court orders $1000 Sign. Bond with no contact provision as requested.  Argn: 3/7/22 at 10:30 a.m.
